pageContext.claim: “After our tax cuts took effect, wages for the lowest-income Americans grew twice as fast as those near the top.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump cannot attribute these gains to his tax cuts. Wages were already increasing before he became president. "The poorest 10 percent of white workers collectively saw a 5.1 percent raise in 2016, twice as faster as the 2 percent growth among the richest decile percent," noted The Atlantic about a month after Trump took office.
